Reliable Printers for Remote Work

June 30, 2025 Marga Enterprises

Reliable Printers for Remote Work: A Smart Choice for Productivity and Sustainability

Working remotely has become the new norm for many professionals. Whether you’re running a small business, freelancing, or part of a hybrid team, one thing remains essential: reliable printers for remote work.

From printing contracts to scanning signed documents, a dependable printer can help keep your workflow smooth and stress-free. In this article, we’ll explore what makes a printer reliable, how to choose the right one for your home setup, and why eco-friendly features should be part of your decision.

Why Reliability Matters in Remote Work Printers

When you're working from home, you can't just walk to the office printer down the hall or ask IT for help when things go wrong. That’s why reliability is non-negotiable. A good remote work printer should offer:

  • Consistent performance

  • Low maintenance

  • Fast print speeds

  • High-quality output

  • Wireless connectivity

A printer that fails at the wrong time can interrupt meetings, delay client deliverables, and cause unnecessary stress.

Key Features to Look For in a Reliable Home Office Printer

Choosing a printer for remote work isn't just about price. Here are the most important features to look for:

1. Multifunction Capabilities

You need more than just printing. A multifunction printer (MFP) that can scan, copy, and even fax is a great all-in-one solution. It saves space and improves efficiency.

2. Wireless and Cloud Connectivity

A remote work setup often includes laptops, tablets, and even smartphones. Look for printers that support Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and cloud services like Google Drive or Dropbox.

3. Duplex Printing

Printing on both sides of the paper (duplex) saves paper and makes your documents look professional—perfect for contracts and reports.

4. Speed and Print Volume

If you print frequently, look for a model with high pages-per-minute (PPM) and a large paper tray. This reduces interruptions during your workday.

Eco-Friendly Considerations for Remote Printers

Remote workers aren’t just looking for performance—they’re also thinking green. Choosing an environmentally responsible printer can reduce your carbon footprint and operating costs.

Here are some important eco-friendly features to watch out for:

1. Energy-Efficient Designs

Some printers are ENERGY STAR® certified and consume less power. Learn more about these options in our article on energy-efficient printers.

2. Recyclable Materials and Programs

Choose printers made with sustainable materials and supported by manufacturer take-back programs. Many providers now offer recycling programs for rental printers.

3. Eco-Friendly Ink and Toner

Toxic waste from conventional ink and toner is a growing problem. Consider devices that support eco-friendly ink and toner options.

4. Sustainable Certification

Look for certifications that guarantee a lower environmental impact. See the top certifications for eco-friendly printers to guide your purchase.

Best Types of Printers for Remote Work

There are several types of printers to choose from. Here's a quick comparison to help you pick:

Printer TypeIdeal ForProsCons
Laser PrintersHigh-volume, black & white documentsFast, durable, low cost/pageExpensive upfront
Inkjet PrintersColor documents, occasional useAffordable, great for photosSlower, higher ink cost
All-in-OneGeneral home office useCombines print/scan/copyCan be bulky
Eco Tank PrintersHigh usage, lower wasteRefillable tanks, low costHigher initial cost

Renting vs. Buying: Which is More Reliable?

If you're unsure whether to buy or rent, here are a few things to consider:

  • Renting allows for lower upfront cost, maintenance support, and easy upgrades.

  • Buying may make sense for long-term use, but you’ll need to handle repairs and replacements yourself.

Eco-conscious professionals might also explore rental providers that support sustainability, such as those who focus on corporate responsibility and printer rentals.

Practical Tips to Maintain Your Printer at Home

Reliability isn’t just about the model you choose—it’s also about how well you take care of it.

  • Keep firmware updated. This ensures your printer stays compatible with the latest software.

  • Use genuine ink/toner. It might be tempting to buy cheap alternatives, but they can damage your printer.

  • Clean your printer regularly. Dust and debris can interfere with print quality and paper feeding.

  • Print at least once a week. For inkjets, this prevents the cartridges from drying out.

Top Recommendations for Remote Workers

Here are a few well-reviewed models known for reliability and remote work performance:

  • HP OfficeJet Pro 9015e – Great for all-in-one printing, fast performance, and eco features.

  • Brother HL-L2395DW – Reliable black-and-white laser printer with Wi-Fi and scan features.

  • Epson EcoTank ET-3850 – High-volume, refillable tank for minimal waste and cost savings.

  • Canon PIXMA TR8620a – Good color printing for presentations and creative professionals.

Before committing, always check user reviews and feedback. You can also explore customer reviews of eco-friendly printers to make an informed decision.

Future-Proofing Your Remote Work Setup

Remote work is here to stay. Investing in a reliable and environmentally conscious printer can:

  • Save time and money

  • Support your workflow

  • Reflect your personal and corporate values

Stay updated with future trends in eco-friendly printer rentals to ensure your setup grows with your career.

Final Thoughts

Choosing reliable printers for remote work isn’t just about specs—it’s about how that device fits into your lifestyle, values, and daily tasks. Whether you buy or rent, prioritize eco-conscious features and support partners that care about sustainability.

Your printer may be small, but it can make a big difference in how you work from home.
